newsitem.title: FRANCE: French govt to sell further 18 mln shares in Bull.
newsitem.headline: French govt to sell further 18 mln shares in Bull.

text.p: The French state will sell a further 18 million shares in Cie des Machines Bull, cutting its stake in the computer maker to around 17 percent, the finance ministry said on Friday.

The ministry said the pre-placement period for institutions would begin on April 14. Retail investors would not have a right to subsribe during the pre-placement period but would be able to buy shares during the offer period at a fixed price.
The timing of the offer period will be announced later, the ministry said.
Bull, which expects significant 1997 net profit growth, said last month it expected the ministry announcement.
The government currently has 30.5 percent of Bull. After the sale, its holding in Bull will equal stakes held by France Telecom, NEC Corp and Motorola Inc.
Bull shares closed down on Friday 1.87 percent at 49.95 francs per share. The Paris Bourse said Bull shares would be suspended from Monday April 14 until further notice.
The placement with institutional French and international investors will be conducted via a book-building exercise.
The price of the shares will be announced at the end of the exercise by the finance ministry which will be advised by the independent privatisation commission.
The sale will be carried out through a global guaranteed placement involving 14.6 million shares and a fixed price offer involving 1.6 million shares.
Some 1.8 million shares will be offered to employees and former Bull employees and the state will give banks in charge of the placement an option to buy 900,000 additional shares.
